key_points: Melania Trump learned of her non-attendance at Biden's inauguration through President Trump's tweet.
Before the tweet on January 8, Melania was uncertain if her husband would break tradition by not attending.
Melania Trump has largely stayed quiet about the efforts to overturn the 2020 election results.
She supported her husband's calls for 'fair elections' after his loss.
A senior White House staffer shared that Melania often learns of her husband's actions through his tweets.
Melania has been preparing for life post-Washington, D.C., including moving belongings to Mar-a-Lago.
She arranged for her son, Barron, to attend school in Florida.
Melania remained silent for five days following the Capitol insurrection on January 6.
Melania released a statement expressing sympathy for the rioters and police officers who died on January 6.
She accused critics of spreading 'salacious gossip' and 'false misleading accusations' against her.
